Barnard has suspended over 1.6 percent of its student body

Since the start of the “Gaza Solidarity Encampment,” Barnard has suspended 55 students. As of Monday, two suspensions have been lifted. Seniors comprise the largest portion of suspended students.

1.64% of Barnard’s student body has been suspended

1 square = 1% of Barnard’s student body

Suspensions by class year:

Seniors: 39.62% (21 students)

Juniors: 32.08% (17 students)

Sophomores: 20.75% (11 students)

First-years: 7.55% (4 students)

1 square = 1% of suspended Barnard students

Note: Data is based off of the total number of suspensions, which includes lifted suspensions. Barnard’s student body size excludes students studying abroad.

Source: Spectator reporting, Barnard College

Graphic by Laya Gollamudi
